intro: Actinotus helianthi, commonly known as the star flower or sunflower of the mountains, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine, silvery down. Actinotus helianthi is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
